org.apache.logging.log4j.appserver.tomcat

Class TomcatLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.logging.log4j.appserver.tomcat.TomcatLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.juli.logging.Log

    public class TomcatLogger
extends Object
implements org.apache.juli.logging.Log
    Implements the Log interface from Tomcat 8.5 and greater. In order to use this class to cause Tomcat to use Log4j for logging, the jar containing this class as well as the log4j-api and log4j-core jars must be added to Tomcat's boot classpath. This is most easily accomplished by placing these jars in a directory and then adding the contents of that directory to the CLASSPATH environment variable in setenv.sh in Tomcat's bin directory. The Log4j configuration file must also be present on the classpath. This implementation will use the first file it finds with one of the following file names: log4j2-tomcat.xml, log4j2-tomcat.json, log4j2-tomcat.yaml, log4j2-tomcat.yml, log4j2-tomcat.properties. Again, this can be accomplished by adding this file to a directory and then adding that directory to the CLASSPATH environment variable in setenv.sh.
    Since:
    2.10.0
